title: Special Emmerdale episode to reveal who shot Robert Sugden by rewinding the clock
text:
Special Emmerdale episode to reveal who shot Robert Sugden by rewinding the clock Special Emmerdale episode to reveal who shot Robert Sugden by rewinding the clock 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Emmerdale will screen an hour-long rewind episode revealing who shot Robert Sugden, played by Ryan Hawley, to celebrate its 43rd birthday. 
In a first for ITV’s rural soap, Emmerdale will break from its usual way of storytelling to show what really happened on that fateful night. Emmerdale’s Robert Sugden played by Ryan Hawley (ITV) 
At the end of October, three secrets will be revealed that will rock the village forever. 
Last week, viewers saw the tables turn for Robert when a mystery assailant shot him in the chest leaving him fighting for his life. 
The villain of the Dales has many enemies after cheating on wife Chrissie (played by Louise Marwood), not to mention killing Katie Sugden (Sammy Winward) and letting his lover Aaron Livesy (Danny Miller) think he was responsible. Emmerdale’s Lawrence White played by John Bowe (ITV) 
The main list of suspects also includes Robert’s foster brother Andy Sugden (Kelvin Fletcher), now a widower following Katie’s death. 
Let’s not forget Chrissie’s son Lachlan White (Thomas Atkinson), who feels his step-dad Robert has also betrayed him. As for Katie’s friend Chas Dingle (Lucy Pargeter) – she has vowed revenge. Could Aaron be the one #WhoShotRobert ? @DannyBMiller gives a possible motive and asks YOU to decide… #Emmerdale pic.twitter.com/KAbX3l8Qii 
— Emmerdale (@emmerdale) September 29, 2015 
Lawrence White (John Bowe), Chrissie’s father, has never liked Robert and tried to stop his daughter from marrying the estate manager. Aaron’s close friend Paddy Kirk (Dominic Brunt) has been trying to stop Robert from hurting his pal for some time. 
Talking about the forthcoming episode reveal, producer Kate Oates said: “This won’t be the first time Emmerdale has broken its ‘house style’ of storytelling; but it will be the first time we’ve told a story in a non-linear way. Share article 
“What makes this ‘rewind’ episode special is that we won’t just learn who shot Robert, but two other big secrets that will propel the show into an exciting, emotional and dramatic winter.” Promoted Stories
